result.execSummary:
The defendant Vladimir Omar Coimbre was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Vladimir Omar Coimbre is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Vladimir Omar Coimbre was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Vladimir Omar Coimbre was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence and Count 3, with credit for 8 DAYS time served, straight time.

miscConds.notes:
Counts 1 & 3: Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.
Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.

No contact with Brenda T, unless approved by court or agent.
No contact with Brenda T.'s minor children, unless approved by court or agent OR Family Court.
Do not use Facebook or Instagram.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER

Batterers Intervention program.
Parenting class.
Absolute sobriety.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
Provide a DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: (as to each count) as Condition Time, STAYED pending review on October 30, 2015.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vladimir Omar Coimbre

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Vladimir Omar Coimbre in court.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Sworn in as Spanish Interpreter, Brenda Bartholomew.
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.
Bail Refund Packets

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Received & Filed, Victim Impact Statements. Court reviewed photographs.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence and Count 3, with credit for 8 DAYS time served, straight time.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 3
The court sentenced the defendant to 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence and Count 1, straight time.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 50 DAYS (as to each count) as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting class
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with Brenda T, unless approved by court or agent.
-No contact with Brenda T.'s minor children, unless approved by court or agent OR Family Court.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Do not use Facebook or Instagram.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state Count 2 is Dismissed.
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 3
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Vladimir Omar Coimbre in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Owen M. Piotrowski & Ben Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: Dawn Maldenado. Case set for Plea & Sentencing.   Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. 
Amended Information Reads:
COUNT 1: Misdemeanor Battery, Domestic Abuse Assessments, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.19(1), 973.055(1), a class A Misdemeanor.
COUNT 2: False Imprisonment, Domestic Abuse Assessment, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.30, 973.055(1), a class H Felony.
COUNT 3: Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse Assessment, contrary to Wis. Stat. 947.01(1), 973.055(1), a class B Misdemeanor.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & FIled, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Vladimir Omar Coimbre in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Bail/Bond Hearing. Defense withdrew Bail/Bond request and WAIVED interpreter for today's hearing only.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Plea & Sentencing date. Case adjourned for Plea & Sentencing to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.
Justice Point

Defendant Vladimir Omar Coimbre in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as intepreter:  Dawn Maldonado.   Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  A/K/A Melendez, Reinaldo added to CCAP  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Vladimir Omar Coimbre in court.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Yvon Roustan. Defendant in court PRO SE. Defendant not eligible for SPD representation. Defendant advised the court that his employment status has changed. Court ordered defendant to report to the SPD for evaluation after going to Justice Point. If defendant does NOT qualify he must return to branch 23 today. If defendant does qualify he is to return to court for an adjourned Preliminary Hearing / Status of Counsel date on 4/30/2015. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

15RM019933  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/14/2015
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.     No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Brenda TR and her children.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady , Branch 23
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. 
Defense enters a plea of not guilty as to Count 3 ( Misdemeanor). 
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
IF RELEASED DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

Defendant Vladimir Omar Coimbre in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  
Defendant Vladimir Omar Coimbre in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Interpreter sworn: Brenda Bartholomew  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
